title: `body not found for block xxx`
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon version 2022.08.3-alpha-b8e81f9`

OS & Version: Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS

Commit hash : 

#### Expected behaviour
Erigon achieves sync

#### Actual behaviour
Erigon does not achieve sync and has `body not found for block` warnings.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Not sure what specific to my configuration is causing this issue. It began after the merge.

`eth1.service`:
`erigon --downloader.verify --datadir /var/lib/erigon --snap.stop --chain mainnet --private.api.addr=localhost:9089 --metrics --metrics.port=6060 --prune htc --authrpc.jwtsecret=/secrets/jwtsecret --http --http.api=engine,net,eth`

Added `snap.stop` recently to fix a previous error: `panic: no gaps in tx ids are allowed: block `
Added `--downloader.verify` recently at the suggestion of enriavil1 on discord
`

#### Logs

```
Sep 16 20:05:13 ethnuc1 erigon[864327]: [INFO] [09-16|20:05:13.843] [txpool] stat                            block=15537393 pending=10000 baseFee=30000 queued=30000 alloc=5.7GB sys=11.5GB
Sep 16 20:05:40 ethnuc1 erigon[864327]: [INFO] [09-16|20:05:40.302] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=100
Sep 16 20:05:52 ethnuc1 erigon[864327]: [WARN] [09-16|20:05:52.367] Served                                   conn=127.0.0.1:58124 method=eth_getBlockByHash reqid=1 t=76.361µs err="body not found for block 15538546, 1faa4ef5bfcab6ad9e2534ec8866d27d8bf799a041e221466b2f943827878844"
Sep 16 20:05:59 ethnuc1 erigon[864327]: [WARN] [09-16|20:05:59.363] Served                                   conn=127.0.0.1:58124 method=eth_getBlockByHash reqid=1 t=296.501138ms err="body not found for block 15538295, a4fe40ccd84a2087be39369387e609143b4d7ed4bfece50ae8ff53e8813cec52"
Sep 16 20:06:13 ethnuc1 erigon[864327]: [INFO] [09-16|20:06:13.931] [txpool] stat                            block=15537393 pending=10000 baseFee=30000 queued=30000 alloc=6.6GB sys=11.5GB
Sep 16 20:07:13 ethnuc1 erigon[864327]: [INFO] [09-16|20:07:13.905] [txpool] stat                            block=15537393 pending=10000 baseFee=30000 queued=30000 alloc=5.8GB sys=11.5GB
Sep 16 20:07:31 ethnuc1 erigon[864327]: [WARN] [09-16|20:07:31.239] Served                                   conn=127.0.0.1:58604 method=eth_getBlockByHash reqid=1 t=74.189µs err="body not found for block 15537394, 56a9bb0302da44b8c0b3df540781424684c3af04d0b7a38d72842b762076a664"
Sep 16 20:07:31 ethnuc1 erigon[864327]: [WARN] [09-16|20:07:31.243] Served                                   conn=127.0.0.1:58604 method=eth_getBlockByHash reqid=1 t=60.434µs err="body not found for block 15537710, 8398c06c780a1be7fadbd5920c21fa07f0a2f3df19b17be265d15a618bf6d60f"
```
Update: Still an issue after update to `erigon version 2022.09.2-dev-62bbc36d`
@enriavil1 would you recommend in this case doing an unwind to before the blocks in the logs above?
can you run `./build/bin/integration print_stages --datadir=/your/datadir/ --chain=some-chain` and post the result here

@enriavil1  `erigon version 2022.09.3-dev-46f8d891` (I just updated)
```
$ build/bin/integration print_stages --datadir /var/lib/erigon --chain mainnet

Note: prune_at doesn't mean 'all data before were deleted' - it just mean stage.Prune function were run to this block. Because 1 stage may prune multiple data types to different prune distance.

 				 stage_at 	 prune_at
Snapshots 			 15395999 	 0
Headers 			 15577374 	 0

first header in db: 15396000
first body in db: 15396000

--
snapsthos: blocks=15395999, segments=15395999, indices=15395999
```
Any warning logs?

It takes me more than a week to resync so I was hoping there was another solution. I'm still seeing `body not found for block` on `46f8d891`

```

you can try re-doing stage bodies through integration tool. `./build/bin/integration stage_body --reset --datadir=/your/datadir --chain=your-chain` and then run erigon again

`unknown command "stage_body" for "integration"`
tried `stage_bodies` and then got `unknown flag: --reset`

Running `print_stages` again I got:

Did you run integration to reset header

Running: `./integration stage_headers --reset --datadir /var/lib/erigon --chain mainnet`

in progress...

> Running: `./integration stage_headers --reset --datadir /var/lib/erigon --chain mainnet`
> 
> 
> 
> in progress...
> 
> 

Also make sure to stop erigon while doing this
I assume this will take a pretty long time?

> I assume this will take a pretty long time?

Yeah. Your print stages will update once it's done

... and no more logs for 10min, is it done 🤷‍♂️ ?
No it should go through head insert and body insert too
well... it seems to just quit or hang. An hour later and no more logs.
I resynced from scratch with a new NVMe ssd and am now seeing the same “body not found for block” error. Please help
Solution found here: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/5639#issuecomment-1272463475
